43.name: clickTo
43.text:
Applications are 100% electronic.

Welcome to the official Bitter Jester Music Festival (BJMF) Online Application. We're excited to consider you for this highly competitive yet friendly event!

In addition to answering questions, you will need the following to apply:

  • Contact / other info for each performer;
  • Emergency contact info for each performer;
  • Two (2) music samples (you must upload files - no links);
  • A hi-res photo of your band (you must upload a 300 dpi or higher image);
  • A stage plot (you must upload a drawing of your band's layout);
  • Your application fee (paid via PayPal or credit/debit card).

If you're under the age of 18, a parent or guardian must authorize your submission, so please ensure that someone is available to help.

PLEASE NOTE: We *strongly encourage* you to type your answers in a *separate saved document* and then copy/paste into this form as you go. This helps prevent losing your answers.

60.answer: Indie-pop-rock-crunch-gaze with a little added zest from almost any genre of rock you can think of.

61.name: howLong61
61.text: How long has your band been playing together?

63.name: doesYour63
63.text: Does your band have a website?

65.name: pleaseWrite65
65.text: Please write a short statement expressing why your band would like to participate:
65.answer: We are very interested in becoming a big part of the midwest music scene, in particular the area that Bitter Jester is held. We have been working hard for our careers to become the best possible musicians and people we can be and our band has been instrumental in making this for us. We want to share this along with our love of music with as many people as we possibly can. Our aim is to show people of all ages and backgrounds a good time and participating in this event would provide us with a fantastic means to our end.

66.name: anyBattles
66.text: Any battles your band has participated in or awards won?

67.name: anyAccolades
67.text: Any accolades or fun things you'd like us to brag about?
67.answer: We're bringing a trumpet. (We've also played a lot of fundraising events to support the fight against suicide, local band programs, and a place called Lion's Tooth in Milwaukee, Wisconsin which aims to provide a safe place for kids in Milwaukee to hang out and have fun instead of getting involved in poor choices of activities out of sheer boredom.)

68.name: tellUs
68.text: Tell us how you plan to promote your concert and the Festival:
68.answer: We will be promoting this event heavily on all of our band and personal social media pages (mainly on Facebook and Instagram) along with guaranteed sharing from many of our fans. We will also be spreading the message through word of mouth and posters at our schools and workplaces.

69.name: willYou69
69.text: Will you have CDs/merch for sale at the concerts?

70.name: anyAudiotech
70.text: Any audio/tech requirements or special requests?
70.answer: All we need are four mic setups, a mixer, and a drum kit, we've got the rest.

43.name: clickTo
43.text:
Applications are 100% electronic.

Welcome to the official Bitter Jester Music Festival (BJMF) Online Application. We're excited to consider you for this highly competitive yet friendly event!

In addition to answering questions, you will need the following to apply:

  • Contact / other info for each performer;
  • Emergency contact info for each performer;
  • Two (2) music samples (you must upload files - no links);
  • A hi-res photo of your band (you must upload a 300 dpi or higher image);
  • A stage plot (you must upload a drawing of your band's layout);
  • Your application fee (paid via PayPal or credit/debit card).

If you're under the age of 18, a parent or guardian must authorize your submission, so please ensure that someone is available to help.

PLEASE NOTE: We *strongly encourage* you to type your answers in a *separate saved document* and then copy/paste into this form as you go. This helps prevent losing your answers.

66.answer: Peter is a 2019 School of Rock All Star

67.name: anyAccolades
67.text: Any accolades or fun things you'd like us to brag about?
67.answer:
Peter Dankelson is a motivational speaker who is rocking his life with a guitar and Goldenhar Syndrome. He’s a 2019 School of Rock All Star who loves blues and classic rock. Peter uses humor and music to explain his differences, encourage inclusion, and inspire students to embrace what makes them different. He’s undergone 35 surgeries as a result of his birth defects and proves that anything’s possible with passion & a positive attitude. Peter motivates students to rock their own life and amplify kindness.

Peter is 19 years old and has shared his story with over 40,000 students. He’s a Music Ambassador and Rare Storyteller for the charity Harmony 4 Hope and a certified #ChooseKind speaker for Children’s Craniofacial Association.

60.name: describeYour60
60.answer: Quick & Painless is a modern rock band, combining the sounds of the 1980s, 90s, 2000s, and 2010s into one cohesive sound. Fans of the Raconteurs, Catfish and the Bottlemen, The Wombats and Arctic Monkeys are sure to find something they love but all fans of rock music will enjoy the combinations of hard-hitting guitar playing, driving bass and unique keyboard melodies!

65.name: pleaseWrite65
65.text: Please write a short statement expressing why your band would like to participate:
65.answer: Our experience at BJMF last year was life-changing. Not only did we get to play more shows in the Chicagoland area but the festival also helped us grow as a band and helped us make a number of new friends. The critiques and suggestions we received from the live-recorded feedback and the judge sheets from both the Friday night performance and the fourth of July show have helped refined how we perform and what we choose to perform at our shows. This is the feedback that is often hard to come by, especially in such an easy to understand and accessible format. Beyond that, the number of friends we made networking with the other bands at the BJMF is just incredible. We remain in close contact with many of the bands we met at the BJMF last summer and we are planning to do shows with many this coming summer!

66.name: anyBattles

67.text: Any accolades or fun things you'd like us to brag about?
67.answer:
Everett is a bit of a custom guitar designer... if you consider setting your guitar on fire a safe, responsible and intelligent means of designing a guitar finish

The band once attempted to fix Ryan's keyboard during a rehearsal but ended up dropping it, causing more damage (but then fixed the whole thing... so like, I suppose we're pros now)

We have played at Summerfest and on top of a single piece of plywood in a park on the same weekend.

43.text:
Applications are 100% electronic.

Welcome to the official Bitter Jester Music Festival (BJMF) Online Application. We're excited to consider you for this highly competitive yet friendly event!

In addition to answering questions, you will need the following to apply:

  • Contact / other info for each performer;
  • Emergency contact info for each performer;
  • Two (2) music samples (you must upload files - no links);
  • A hi-res photo of your band (you must upload a 300 dpi or higher image);
  • A stage plot (you must upload a drawing of your band's layout);
  • Your application fee (paid via PayPal or credit/debit card).

If you're under the age of 18, a parent or guardian must authorize your submission, so please ensure that someone is available to help.

PLEASE NOTE: We *strongly encourage* you to type your answers in a *separate saved document* and then copy/paste into this form as you go. This helps prevent losing your answers.

63.name: doesYour63
63.text: Does your band have a website?

65.name: pleaseWrite65
65.text: Please write a short statement expressing why your band would like to participate:
65.answer: Joey had a blast performing last year. And all the feedback was very useful for him. He hopes to get a chance to play at Navy Pier this year. That would be an awesome venue to play at.

66.name: anyBattles
66.text: Any battles your band has participated in or awards won?
66.answer: Joey was a Suburban Chicago's Got Talent Finalist the last two years, he has also performed at half time of a Chicago Bulls game the last two years, in front of 20,000 and 18,000 people. As well as performing in The Bitter Jester Music Festival last year. He also won a talent competition at the Taste of Streamwood, on the main stage at their festival.

67.name: anyAccolades
67.text: Any accolades or fun things you'd like us to brag about?
67.answer: Joey loves playing his music to as many people as possible. I love watching how excited he gets before playing a big show. He's been out to record twice in Los Angeles and will have an EP ready to release by June.

68.name: tellUs
68.text: Tell us how you plan to promote your concert and the Festival:
68.answer: Joey posts his upcoming events on Instagram and Facebook, and we'll probably have a big group of family and friends out to watch him again this year, if he makes it.

69.name: willYou69
69.text: Will you have CDs/merch for sale at the concerts?

70.name: anyAudiotech
70.text: Any audio/tech requirements or special requests?
70.answer: Pretty straight forward. Guitar, Microphone, and loop pedal. This year, we would like to get there earlier to do a soundcheck, if possible. Joey got some weird feedback when using the loop pedal last year, and bailed on it. If we got there early and got him comfortable, it would go a lot smoother.

43.name: clickTo
43.text:
Applications are 100% electronic.

Welcome to the official Bitter Jester Music Festival (BJMF) Online Application. We're excited to consider you for this highly competitive yet friendly event!

In addition to answering questions, you will need the following to apply:

  • Contact / other info for each performer;
  • Emergency contact info for each performer;
  • Two (2) music samples (you must upload files - no links);
  • A hi-res photo of your band (you must upload a 300 dpi or higher image);
  • A stage plot (you must upload a drawing of your band's layout);
  • Your application fee (paid via PayPal or credit/debit card).

If you're under the age of 18, a parent or guardian must authorize your submission, so please ensure that someone is available to help.

PLEASE NOTE: We *strongly encourage* you to type your answers in a *separate saved document* and then copy/paste into this form as you go. This helps prevent losing your answers.

53.name: wouldYou
53.text: Would you like to check out our Online FAQ?
53.answer: No thanks - I don't have any questions.

60.name: describeYour60
60.answer: Classified as Indie and Alternative, our music shows elements of Jazz and Blues from chords, vocals, and lyrics, our blended music gets people up and moving every time!

61.name: howLong61
61.text: How long has your band been playing together?

63.name: doesYour63
63.text: Does your band have a website?

65.name: pleaseWrite65
65.text: Please write a short statement expressing why your band would like to participate:
65.answer: We all individually have increasingly impressive amounts of talent and the band itself has been doing very well, we have been on radio shows, numerous festivals/fund raisers, and have a growing fan base. we want to see new faces and reach new people. We feel this could be a wonderful opportunity to us and everyone involved, bringing new music and new faces all around growing all parties.

66.name: anyBattles
66.text: Any battles your band has participated in or awards won?
66.answer: We have won the local high school talent show four separate times, along with placing third at the Alpena fair ground talent show

67.name: anyAccolades
67.text: Any accolades or fun things you'd like us to brag about?
67.answer: We started to make moves and released our first album while our lead singer was only 17, We still sell CD's in 2020, and have made radio appearances all around Michigan

68.name: tellUs
68.text: Tell us how you plan to promote your concert and the Festival:
68.answer: We will promote frequently on our two base platforms which are Instagram and Facebook, also verbally and potential flyers around our hometown so locals knows whats up :)

69.name: willYou69
69.text: Will you have CDs/merch for sale at the concerts?

70.name: anyAudiotech
70.text: Any audio/tech requirements or special requests?
70.answer: We have 2 guitars and 1 bass and just as many amps to go along with; Hoping you guys have your own PA system we can use.
